channel.description:
OK, I have tryed to get a server up and running before, but had no luck, i am trying again, and I've set up my no-ip, i've port fowarded my router, I've changed the paths on my fire wall, I've edited the client and "run" and "compiler" files, so idk what the problem could be :confused: When i use the moparscape client, i type into the ip "127.0.0.1" I've also tryed "0.0.0.0" and it acts like its trying to log me in, because i can see the inventory thing, just nothing in it, and the minimap is black, and so is the srceen, and then about 5 seconds latter, i get taken back to the login screen, much help would be appreciated :cool:
HERE IS WHAT IT SAYS IN MY CMD PROMPT when i try to log in [img]http://imgtool.in/images/helpl0x.png[/img]

item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

In the future please make your title summarize the problem. You’ll probably get help quicker.

“Cannot login using MoparScape client”
“[317] T2 Error”

Etc.

Anyway, you have a packet error and since I can’t remember if the T2 error is caused by the server or the client I’ll leave this in Server Help.

In short; your client isn’t compatible with your server and vice versa.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Ecstacy_Pkz Ecstacy Pkz
item.description:
@Ecstacy_Pkz wrote:

The biggest mistake that people make when portforwarding that messes everything up, is when setting the IP you use to portforward, it MUST be your IPv4 address, otherwize you will not be portforwarded.

Click on the Start Menu button on your desktop type in the search bar “Cmd”
Open CMD and once it is open type “ipconfig” Without the “” marks.

Look for your IPv4 Address and use that one. GL

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Waterfire Waterfire
item.description:
@Waterfire wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:3, topic:416937”]use your own client, the MSCP client does not support all servers.[/quote]Well why doe sit say “error connecting to server” when i try to login on my client when I’ve portfowarded, set-up my no-ip, i’ve set the envoirmental variables, I’ve changed the compiler, however i used guides from like the 07’s soo… oh and I’ve also installed new jdk and jre and java and changed the run and compiler’s accordingly… idk what the problem is… please help I’d love you forever if you help me solve this anyone

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @modzilla modzilla
item.description:
@modzilla wrote:

[quote=“pk2play, post:5, topic:416937”][quote author=Waterfire link=topic=518875.msg3770951#msg3770951 date=1317678549]

Most servers come with a client that your supposed to use, dont use the moparscape one. it’s for really old servers.
[/quote]Can’t get on my client, it says “error connecting to server”
and when i try to do the port checker on “Canyouseeme.org” this comes up
Error: I could not see your service on 208.75.102.136 on port (43594)
Reason: Connection refused

which doesnt make sense because i port fowarded on my router please help me??

This happened to me as well, I got it working by going onto my modem homepage and opening the port there as well.[/quote]

Dont you mean router homepage?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @pk2play pk2play
item.description:
@pk2play wrote:

[quote=“Waterfire, post:4, topic:416937”][quote author=Ecstacy Pkz link=topic=518875.msg3770944#msg3770944 date=1317678294]
Most servers come with a client that your supposed to use, dont use the moparscape one. it’s for really old servers.
[/quote]Can’t get on my client, it says “error connecting to server”
and when i try to do the port checker on “Canyouseeme.org” this comes up
Error: I could not see your service on 208.75.102.136 on port (43594)
Reason: Connection refused

which doesnt make sense because i port fowarded on my router please help me??[/quote]
This happened to me as well, I got it working by going onto my modem homepage and opening the port there as well.

Read full topic

item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

use your own client, the MSCP client does not support all servers.
